Package ui.drawing.layout

Class BorderSection<T extends Section>

  • java.lang.Object
    • ui.drawing.DrawableSection
      • ui.drawing.layout.BorderSection<T>
  • Type Parameters:
    T - The type of section to border.
    All Implemented Interfaces:
    PrintHandler, Section
    Direct Known Subclasses:
    ResponsiveBorderSection, SelectableBorderedSection
    public class BorderSection<T extends Section>
extends DrawableSection
    Adds a border around another section.
    Represents a section that can be drawn to the terminal window.

    • Nested Class Summary

      Nested Classes 
      Modifier and Type Class Description
      static class  BorderSection.Border
      Stores different possible border character sets.

      • getRow

        public void getRow​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                   int row,
                   int startCol,
                   int maxCols)
        Generates a single line of the section to be written to the terminal. In this case write the border characters around the underlying section's getRow result. If it is the first or last row just draw border.
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row of the section to generate.
        startCol - The column of the section to start at.
        maxCols - The max number of columns to draw.

      • doAppend

        private void doAppend​(ColouredStringBuilder builder,
                      int row,
                      boolean right)
        Appends a border character from the first or last column.
        Parameters:
        builder - ColouredStringBuilder to handle ANSI colour coding in the most efficient manner.
        row - Which row to generate.
        right - Boolean; true if in the rightmost column, false for leftmost.

      • getChar

        private ColouredChar getChar​(char character)
        Gets a coloured char from a character with the border's colours.
        Parameters:
        character - The character to colour.
        Returns:
        The coloured char.

      • getRows

        public int getRows()
        Getter for number of rows. In this case return the rows of the underlying section plus the height of the border characters.
        Returns:
        The height of the section in characters.

      • getColumns

        public int getColumns()
        Getter for number of columns. In this case return the columns of the underlying section plus the width of the border characters.
        Returns:
        The width of the section in characters.

      • update

        public void update()
        Called before drawing the section. In this case update the underlying section.
        Specified by:
        update in interface Section
        Overrides:
        update in class DrawableSection
